ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Absolutely. Reading the advanced texts that we do really provides a solid basis for any work with Arabic in the future.
I would definitely recommend the course. The material was fun and interesting. Though the program is as yet a bit disorganized, a lot of those issues will resolve themselves in subsequent years.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course really solidified and further deepened my understanding of Arabic grammar. In addition to learning more vocabulary and common usage patterns, this course has helped me develop a keener sense of how different linguistic patterns can be used to convey the same (or different) meanings depending on context.

I felt that reading the novels was particularly helpful in improving my ability to read. I would have preferred more speaking and listening exercises, since these are the skills I will most need in my field, rather than reading texts.
Obviously, since it's a language course, it deepened my knowledge a lot.
